title: At-Home Solutions for Every Level of Gray Coverage
description: Whether you’re looking to camouflage a few strands or are seeking a more permanent approach, No Gray has got you covered.

text: Gray hair is inevitable, but how we choose to manage it has never been more flexible. Some of us are touch-up-on-the-go between salon appointments types; others like to handle our grays at home with DIY permanent dye—but either way, the range of options available today means you can tailor your coverage to your lifestyle. No matter where you fall on the spectrum, one at-home hair color brand to know is No Gray. The hair-care company offers several solutions to make covering grays a quick and easy process. Here, we break down three ways to use them, based on ease, commitment, and results.The Quick FixConsider No Gray Quick Fix, a root touch-up wand, your go-to for instant, temporary coverage. It’s easy to use and portable, and provides instant short-term results—perfect for covering grays between hair appointments, or on days when you need a literal quick fix without the hassle of a full treatment. “Quick Fix can fit in your purse, and it’s like makeup for your hair—just swipe and go,” says Whitney Moorman, No Gray’s brand manager. Plus, the new and improved formula isn't just for the hair on your head—it’s transfer-resistant so it's great for eyebrows, too.Moorman leaned on this product herself during her pregnancy, when the instant convenience, along with the scalp-friendly formula infused with aloe vera and rosemary extract, made it a comforting go-to. She recalls: “I was six months pregnant, battling morning sickness, and the last thing I could imagine was committing to a full-color treatment. I even used it in the hospital when my baby arrived, and visitors were snapping photos left and right.” For best results, you apply Quick Fix to clean, dry hair using the precision wand to target gray areas, then blend with the built-in comb for a natural finish. The coverage resists sweat and stays put until you wash it out. No Gray Quick Fix Hair ColorThe Semi-Permanent OptionSemi-permanent dye is a great approach for those who want to extend the time between salon visits without fully committing to permanent color. However, “semi-permanent color doesn’t always offer full gray coverage on its own,” says Moorman. That’s where No Gray Color Drops come in. The color additive, which is designed to be mixed with at-home hair color, “boosts its ability to adhere to gray strands without the long-term commitment,” she explains.Color Drops are versatile enough to work with most boxed hair color brands, says Moorman. For optimal results, she recommends mixing one packet of drops into the dye before applying to ensure even color distribution and maximum coverage. No Gray Color DropsThe Permanent Dye JobIf you’re ready to commit to a long-term solution for gray coverage, No Gray Color Drops paired with permanent hair color can give you the lasting color you need. This combination offers full coverage that can withstand multiple washes, making it ideal for those who want a low-maintenance yet high-impact solution.“Permanent dye with Color Drops is for those who want vibrant color that lasts without constant reapplication,” says Moorman. This approach not only covers grays, but also helps the color adhere more effectively, ensuring a smooth, consistent look. Whether you’re a seasoned home colorist or a beginner, Moorman always recommends doing a strand test to ensure you’re receiving the right amount of coverage (if you have extremely resistant gray hair, two Color Drops packets can be used) and dividing your hair into sections during application to achieve an even finish.Laura Lajiness Kaupke is a freelance writer and editor covering fashion, accessories, and lifestyle topics, including beauty, home, fitness, and travel. html:
Gray hair is inevitable, but how we choose to manage it has never been more flexible. Some of us are touch-up-on-the-go between salon appointments types; others like to handle our grays at home with DIY permanent dye—but either way, the range of options available today means you can tailor your coverage to your lifestyle.

No matter where you fall on the spectrum, one at-home hair color brand to know is No Gray. The hair-care company offers several solutions to make covering grays a quick and easy process. Here, we break down three ways to use them, based on ease, commitment, and results.

The Quick Fix

Consider No Gray Quick Fix, a root touch-up wand, your go-to for instant, temporary coverage. It’s easy to use and portable, and provides instant short-term results—perfect for covering grays between hair appointments, or on days when you need a literal quick fix without the hassle of a full treatment. “Quick Fix can fit in your purse, and it’s like makeup for your hair—just swipe and go,” says Whitney Moorman, No Gray’s brand manager. Plus, the new and improved formula isn't just for the hair on your head—it’s transfer-resistant so it's great for eyebrows, too.

Moorman leaned on this product herself during her pregnancy, when the instant convenience, along with the scalp-friendly formula infused with aloe vera and rosemary extract, made it a comforting go-to. She recalls: “I was six months pregnant, battling morning sickness, and the last thing I could imagine was committing to a full-color treatment. I even used it in the hospital when my baby arrived, and visitors were snapping photos left and right.”

For best results, you apply Quick Fix to clean, dry hair using the precision wand to target gray areas, then blend with the built-in comb for a natural finish. The coverage resists sweat and stays put until you wash it out.

No Gray Quick Fix Hair Color

The Semi-Permanent Option

Semi-permanent dye is a great approach for those who want to extend the time between salon visits without fully committing to permanent color. However, “semi-permanent color doesn’t always offer full gray coverage on its own,” says Moorman. That’s where No Gray Color Drops come in. The color additive, which is designed to be mixed with at-home hair color, “boosts its ability to adhere to gray strands without the long-term commitment,” she explains.

Color Drops are versatile enough to work with most boxed hair color brands, says Moorman. For optimal results, she recommends mixing one packet of drops into the dye before applying to ensure even color distribution and maximum coverage.

No Gray Color Drops

The Permanent Dye Job

If you’re ready to commit to a long-term solution for gray coverage, No Gray Color Drops paired with permanent hair color can give you the lasting color you need. This combination offers full coverage that can withstand multiple washes, making it ideal for those who want a low-maintenance yet high-impact solution.

“Permanent dye with Color Drops is for those who want vibrant color that lasts without constant reapplication,” says Moorman. This approach not only covers grays, but also helps the color adhere more effectively, ensuring a smooth, consistent look. Whether you’re a seasoned home colorist or a beginner, Moorman always recommends doing a strand test to ensure you’re receiving the right amount of coverage (if you have extremely resistant gray hair, two Color Drops packets can be used) and dividing your hair into sections during application to achieve an even finish.
